Poems (1896), 182, stanzas 1-3, with the alternatives for line 8 adopted. BM (1945), 165, stanzas 4-7, with the alternatives adopted for lines 14, 21, 26, 27, 28 ("touch"), from an incomplete transcript of A (a tr352). Poems (1955), 441-42; CP (1960), 281-82. MB (1981), 321-23, in facsimile. (J577)

Houghton Library - (142a) If I may have it, when it's dead, J577, Fr431

body.value:
F431A - If I may have it when it's dead

If I may have it, when it's
dead,
 I'll be contented - so -
If just as soon as Breath
is out
It shall belong to me -

Until they lock it in the
Grave,
 'Tis Wealth I cannot weigh. • Right [I cannot weigh.] Bliss I cannot weigh -
For tho' they lock Thee in
the Grave,
Myself - can hold own the key -

Think of it Lover! I and Thee
Permitted - face to face to be -
 After a Life - a Death -
we'll say -
For Death was That -
And This - is Thee -

I'll tell Thee All - how Blank - Bald
it grew -
How Midnight felt, at first -
to me -
 How all the Clocks stopped
in the World -
And Sunshine pinched me -
'Twas so cold -

Then how the Grief got sleepy -
some -
As if my soul were deaf and
dumb -
Just making signs - it seemed across -
to Thee -
 That this way - thou could'st
speak to - notice me -

I'll tell you how I tried to keep
A smile, to show you, when
this Deep
All Waded - We look back
for Play,
At those Old Times - in Calvary.

Forgive me, if the Grave seem come
slow -
For eagerness - Coveting to look at Thee -
Forgive me, if to touch • greet stroke
thy frost
[Out]fables - Outvisions Paradise!

en:
Houghton Library, Harvard University, Cambridge, MA
Dickinson, Emily, 1830-1886. Poems: Packet XXVI, Fascicle 15 (part). Includes 8 poems, written in ink, dated ca. 1862.
Houghton Library - (142a) If I may have it, when it's dead, J577, Fr431
Publication History
Poems (1896), 182, stanzas 1-3, with the alternatives for line 8 adopted. BM (1945), 165, stanzas 4-7, with the alternatives adopted for lines 14, 21, 26, 27, 28 ("touch"), from an incomplete transcript of A (a tr352). Poems (1955), 441-42; CP (1960), 281-82. MB (1981), 321-23, in facsimile. (J577). Franklin Variorum 1998 (F431A).
-History from Franklin Variorum 1998
